","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T14:39:50.108Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":95.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":480357,"topic_slug":"6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept","display_username":"Akhil Rao Narahari","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54718,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 467"},"post_url":"/t/6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept/480357/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 467","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3476674,"name":"Harrison Stallings","username":"harrisonstallings","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T14:58:16.744Z","cooked":"

The main idea is to intake coral from the station from either the front or side of the robot. The ‚Äúhopper‚Äù would be able to deposit the coral on L1-L4 from either the left or right of the robot. The mechanisms to control the algae are mounted on a wrist and the algae can be dislodged during the coral deposit. It can also pick the algae off the ground and score them in the processor. The deep climb is accomplished with a linear actuator pushing the cage through the bottom of the robot. Very similar to the Penn State Ri3D.

Screenshot 2025-01-09 095438601√ó657 165 KB

arnara07:

Pretty sure the climb would be illegal based on bumper rules

Which rule(s) make you suggest this? The blue box from R405 states:

The part about ‚Äúvirtually transposed onto a flat floor‚Äù would be the deciding call on the legality of the climb.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T15:54:34.789Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":108.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":480357,"topic_slug":"6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept","display_username":"Alex Richards","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32891,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Design & Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept/480357/9","custom_user_title":"Design & Strategy Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3476777,"name":"2582","username":"chadr03","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadr03/{size}/195529_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T16:10:45.816Z","cooked":"

This is the rule I would watch out for:

image740√ó753 138 KB

See Example 2 In the Blue Box

The way I interoperate the rule any mechanism that comes out of the bottom of your robot must not lift the bumpers up more than to 2.5" from the floor.

So I think the image above this would be okay, but the cad shared by OP would not. And since the bottom surface of the cage is ~3-7/8 in off the floor I think you could still get a valid climb, but just can‚Äôt go too deep.

I do think there should be a Q&A to clarify this because several OA/Ri3D and posts have discussed this type of climb.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T16:12:55.328Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":179.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":480357,"topic_slug":"6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept","display_username":"2582","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32891,"username":"alex.richards48","name":"Alex Richards","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alex.richards48/{size}/123035_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13827,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept/480357/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3476789,"name":"Alex Richards","username":"alex.richards48","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alex.richards48/{size}/123035_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T16:20:57.394Z","cooked":"
chadr03:

I do think there should be a Q&A to clarify this because several OA/Ri3D and posts have discussed this type of climb.

Agreed. I wanted to bring this discussion up for this team before any design decisions are finalized.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T16:20:57.394Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":89.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":480357,"topic_slug":"6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept","display_username":"Alex Richards","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32891,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Design & Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept/480357/11","custom_user_title":"Design & Strategy Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3477088,"name":"Matt Golman","username":"BordomBeThyName","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bordombethyname/{size}/147649_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T19:44:52.678Z","cooked":"

I worry about your CG. Dual double sided end effectors are going to add a ton of weight and complexity with no added functionality. The climb is definitely illegal, but if you limit the travel of the ‚Äúfoot‚Äù to the plane of your wheels then it can still work.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T19:44:52.678Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":480357,"topic_slug":"6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept","display_username":"Matt Golman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9246,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Retired üå¥"},"post_url":"/t/6340-2025-krayoncad-robot-concept/480357/12","custom_user_title":"Retired üå¥","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3477271,"name":"William Duong","username":"wduong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/ad7895/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T21:52:42.585Z","cooked":"

thank you for your comments and concerns. We have taken this into account and made some modifications to our design. Thank you as well for your comment about the foot of the linear actuator.

Cost-Effective","slug":"half-inch-hex-shaft-collar-lightweight-durable-and-cost-effective","posts_count":10,"reply_count":6,"highest_post_number":11,"image_url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/4X/6/1/5/6159125f99e5df21476a339efd63df228bdb325d_2_1024x534.png","created_at":"2025-07-10T20:37:41.784Z","last_posted_at":"2025-07-11T04:33:22.248Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-07-11T04:33:22.248Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"Hi
